content:
When validating a resource, I get this error message: 

"issue": [
        {
            "severity": "error",
            "code": "processing",
            "diagnostics": "Slicing cannot be evaluated: Problem evaluating slicing expression for element in profile http://kvalitetsregistre.no/fhir/StructureDefinition/colonoscopyreport-bundle-gastronet path Bundle.entry[1] (fhirPath = true and resource.conformsTo('http://kvalitetsregistre.no/fhir/StructureDefinition/colonoscopyreport-subprocedure-gastronet')): Cannot invoke \"org.hl7.fhir.r5.model.StructureDefinition.getType()\" because \"sd\" is null",
            "location": [
                "Bundle.entry[1]",
                "Line 59, Col 6"
            ]
        }

Looks to me that it can't find: http://kvalitetsregistre.no/fhir/StructureDefinition/colonoscopyreport-subprocedure-gastronet, but I double checked, and that profile is in the package. Can anyone help me understand what's going on?
Can you put the resource that you're trying to validate somewhere we can see it?

Sure!
https://simplifier.net/NorwegianColonoscopyReport/Bundle-example-gastronet/~json

Package:
https://simplifier.net/packages/colonoscopyreport.no/0.7.4
That FHIR server (http://kvalitetsregistre.no/fhir) is 404. That might be your problem.
For further help, #hapi might be a better choice

Well, the canonical URLs don't resolve, the conformance resources are in the package. I'm just wondering what the error message from the java validator actually means. I should be in the right space for that.
it shouldn't be relevant that the URL doesn't resolve.
ok I found and fixed a bug deep in FHIRPath .conformsTo() which was internally used validating that resource. So now I get:
no.errors.log
let me know if you think that's wrong

Great, thanks Grahame!
The rest of the errors look like errors that are fixed with adding a terminology server containing the Norwegian version of SNOMED CT, so those are expected :)
Marten Smits has marked this topic as resolved.
we should add the norwegian version of snomed to tx.fhir.org - does someone from norway want to assist with that?

Grahame Grieve said:

we should add the norwegian version of snomed to tx.fhir.org - does someone from norway want to assist with that?

I can talk to the norwegian SNOMED team to analyze some approaches to actually achieve this. As Marten point out this makes for a lot unnecessary errors in the build pipeline.
well, they just have to tell us how to get approval to use the national distribution, like we have approval for many other countries
Yes, exactly. The easiest way may be to arrange this through MLDS. @Thomas Tveit Rosenlund
Let me know if and when the Norwegian edition is available.

Rob Hausam said:

Yes, exactly. The easiest way may be to arrange this through MLDS. Thomas Tveit Rosenlund

MLDS?

Thomas Tveit Rosenlund said:

I can talk to the norwegian SNOMED team to analyze some approaches to actually achieve this. As Marten point out this makes for a lot unnecessary errors in the build pipeline.

@Espen Stranger Seland Do you have any additional strings to pull. Can't seem to get an answer from Linn or JÃ¸rn at the moment.

Yes, it's the SNOMED Int. Member Licensing and Distribution Service.
@Thomas Tveit Rosenlund @Espen Stranger Seland

Rob Hausam said:

Yes, it's the SNOMED Int. Member Licensing and Distribution Service.
Thomas Tveit Rosenlund Espen Stranger Seland

I have someone that can help me with this. As I understand it someone (HL7 International?) needs persmission to use the norwegian edition of SNOMED in their terminology services. One possible approach is to use the SNOMED MLDS. Would an approval for use of the norwegian edition by HL7 International suffice? I don't think they have ever tried to make such an permission for the norwegian edition before.

in the beginning it was always a fun ride to get permission from the national office to bring their edition into the publication infrastructure, but now that it's a well established pathway, it's pretty straight forward.
Someone makes the application on behalf of HL7 to get a agreement to host the edition on tx.fhir.org which means we can include it in published IGs. And then one of us will load it
Yes, that's how it would work.
I filled in a form requesting use of the Norwegian edition of SNOMED CT in Health Level Seven International terminology tooling and profiling. Let's see of that works out.
